sections.title: Overview
sections.content: This game offers a strategy-based board game experience where players take turns placing their respective symbols on the board. The objective is to achieve a specific configuration of symbols before the opponent does.

subsections.title: Player Selection
subsections.content: Players can choose a 2-player or a 3-player game.

subsections.title: Symbol Selection
subsections.content: Each player selects a distinct symbol. Available symbols: X, O, Z, and W. The number of available symbols will depend on the number of players.

subsections.title: Board Selection
subsections.content: Players select a game board size: Easy (4x4 grid), Middle (7x7 grid), Hard (10x10 grid). Note: In a 3-player game, the "Easy" size is disabled.

subsections.title: Turn Sequence
subsections.content: Players take turns placing their symbol on the board. The order is determined by the sequence of symbol selection.

subsections.title: Placing Symbols
subsections.content: A player can only place their symbol in a valid cell. A cell is considered valid if it's empty and directly above it (if any) is occupied.

subsections.title: Winning Condition
subsections.content: A player wins when they have their symbols in a specific configuration: 3 in a row horizontally, vertically, or diagonally.

subsections.title: Time Limit
subsections.content: Each player has a limited time to make their move. If a player doesn't make a move within the time limit, an automatic move is made for them.

subsections.title: Pause & End Game
subsections.content: Players have the option to pause the game timer. Players can also choose to end the game prematurely.

subsections.title: Victory
subsections.content: The game ends when one player achieves the winning condition. That player is then declared the winner.

subsections.title: Leaderboard
subsections.content: The game records the most recent winners. Up to ten winners can be displayed in the leaderboard.
